comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: Per Google's translation service "vorne" means front, but of what is that the front in the lower left?

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Photo is stamped 19th Feb 1913. Marked Blohm & Voss. More about Blohm + Voss on Wikipedia.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content:
perfgeek,  
My suspicion is that "vorne" here is more in the sense of "fore", as in "fore and aft," which describes the axis of a vessel from bow to stern.  When parts are constructed for later installation, it is usual to mark or label them to ensure they are installed the right way round.  So "vorne" probably indicates that the turbine is to be installed so that the tube facing us is pointing forwards in the ship.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: since the ship was launched 04-03-1913 this must be well before that. This would be one of 4 turbines.
